This is soooo good it moved me to tears. The story play, the music, the adrenaline rush of this game. Holy sh*t it's crazy!
I recommend this game to the gamers who love shooting game and adventures. And I don't understand why there are a lot bad reviews. This game is awesome! Kudos to the developers

HOLY FUCK.

I'm typically not a fan of FPS games, but this was honestly one of the best games I ever played. The gameplay was simple enough for a novice like me to use, but challenging enough that it made me work and strategize to win. The designs were mindblowing, the concept creative, the characters memorable, and don't even get me started on that story! Thanks to a friend, I had had the ending spoiled for me months before I started playing, but even with that knowledge, the storytelling kept me hooked, and the finale still hit me like a ton of bricks.

Easily 13/10. Can't wait to check out the DLC.

Great game. wish I found it sooner.  Also liked how I really didn't need to play the first two Bioshocks to enjoy it.  If anything just which there was more exploration, but fantastic story.  Will play it again in the far future if I somewhat forget the story.

После всего проведённого времени в Bioshock Infinite я понял, насколько это прекрасная игра.. Эти ощущения, эти эмоции, просто не передать словами.. Как по мне, так это лучшая игра своего времени. Здесь есть всё, что нужно в играх подобного жанра: Прекрасный саундтрек, великолепный сюжет, отличная атмосфера и бесподобные персонажи.

Bioshock Infinite takes players to the floating city of Columbia, where as Booker, they team up with a girl named Elizabeth trying to escape the city.

Pros:
-Amazing story that tied the player emotionally
-Voice casting and sounds
-Graphics
-Visual design
-Gameplay Mechanics
-Elizabeth
-Lots of exploration and navigation
-Combat

Cons:
-Story is a bit hard to understand (not really a con, but should be noted)

Overall, this is an amazing game with an amazing story. Story is a bit mind bending like Nolan's Movies, but it's the strongest aspect of this game.

Score: 9.8/10

[h1]Captivating story that will leave you speechless![/h1]

Good gameplay, graphics, voice acting and combat system.

I do miss a little stealth in this game, especially in situations on hard mode in a pinch, where your only chance of success depends on headshot kills and how many bullets you have in your gun.

Other than that it is a great game that I gladly recommend!

[u][b]PS![/b] You do not come back from this game. Play at own risk.[/u]
Perfeito! Ele consegue contar a historia sem atrapalhar o gameplay, é um dos melhores que eu ja joguei. Recomendo! E também as DLC's.

But seriously, once you finish this, you will be sitting there, thinking and speechless. After hours of sitting around being speechless, I gathered up my words for this game. These words are: I'm still speechless.

10/10 Story and Gameplay. 
The best thing about the game is your companion Elizabeth.
1) She can take care of herself in combat.
2) She will find ammo, health kits, coins for you etc.
3) She can manipulate time and space for you.
I had played it my first 3 times on xbox and my 4th on pc. The story is a pure masterpiece that will never be forgotten by all who had the privilege of playing it.
10 из 10 Стерите мне память чтобы я прошёл её снова

It should be noted since the game title comes off as false advertising, this is nothing like previous Bioshocks. You will see a scene for 2 mins that is like past ones but that is it. It comes off like buying an orange and being given a grapefruit. This game has nice graphics and what comes off as much more fun to play (sliding along zipline stuff), at the cost of the less detailed, more horror type environment the previous ones are known for.
 
The game itself however is very good with the combat being a lot more fun and the adventure more lively. It has a steampunk and future like feel while keeping many classic settings and music that the previous versions had. One big change for combat is the magic skills and only being able to carry 2 weapons at once, but at least there are no ammo issues this time. The game itself is a bit easier than previous ones even on hardest difficulty since there is more balance, but now death has a penalty (lose some money and enemies regen some hp).

Best deal is get it on sale around the 10$ mark, unless you believe companies should receive 50+ for a 10 hour adventure.

Personal experience score: 10/10

Story: 9/10 - Pretty interesting. Comes off a bit as the prince saving a princess type scenario but with a lot more depth

Sound: 10/10 - Good sound throughout

Graphics: 10/10 - Very nice looking and the scenery and locations are enjoyable

Controls: 10/10 - Easy to use but the default is different from previous Bioshocks, recommended to use retro for old style

Game Length: 6.5/10 - Only about 12 hours without any DLC. In this case it is just too short like previous Bioshocks.
EL MEJOR PUTO JUEGO DEL PUTO SIGLO

The game was pretty fun, although a bit short. Hard to replay as not much you can do but follow the story. The weapons and vigors were awesome, as well as picking up different weapons as you ran out of ammo for the ones you had, locating salts for your vigors. Did not end as expected, got this deep and thought provoking ending, which fit nicely.

Ce jeu ... Que dire, je dois avouer que mes avis sur celui-ci sont partagés.

Je trouve le scénario complexe, mais cependant très intéressant et instructif.
La première fois que vous poserez le pied sur Columbia, 
le scénario sera déjà flou mais pas autant que dans les heures suivantes. 
Quoiqu'il en soit, ce scénario est tiré à la fois d'un recueil sur la physique quantique mais aussi d'un roman à l'intrigue policière et sombre qui vous prend en haleine pendant de nombreux mois.

Le point négatif, majeur, de ce jeu est cependant le gameplay.
Il ne varie que très peu et se montre très répétitif le long des diffèrents niveaux qui constituent les chapitres de ce jeu.
Les toniques ( pouvoirs ) mis à votre disposition prennent rapidement la poussière.
Pour ma part, je me contentais d'user des mêmes toniques tout le long du jeu, 
car j'étais plus familier avec eux.
Il faut avouer que les toniques, qui sont au nombre de 9 / 10, sont peu originaux vis-à-vis des toniques des jeux précèdents de la franchise Bioshock.

Après les toniques, nous avons les armes. Il faut savoir qu'elles constituent 70% du gameplay, que vous le vouliez ou non vous serez amené à délaisser votre tonique préféré et / ou votre arme de CàC pour une arme beaucoup plus bourrine.
Pour moi qui préfère largement des jeux tels que Dishonored où l'arme à feu est clairement secondaire, ce fut un choc.
Mais le fait qu'elles occupent la place principale du gameplay n'est pas le problème premier, le problème véritable est qu'elles sont dénuées d'intérêt de gameplay. 
Sachant qu'elles en font grandement parties, ça rend alors celui-ci très monotone,
long et répétitif. Les ennemis, eux, ont des IA respectables ( même si s'accroupir devant un garde, parfois, ne les alerte pas ! ).

En bref, un jeu au scénario d'or et au gameplay bétoneux sans aucune délicatesse: je le recommande tout de même.

Che dire.. ho aspettato molto per giocarci, maledizione stavo per perdermi un Gioco davvero grandioso!

Если честно, я садился за эту игру с мыслью просто пострелять по противникам, и посмотреть что же изменилось в серии BioShock со времен первой игры (в которую я играл , но сюжет меня не впечатлил)  Ушел в слезах. Честно. Ибо сюжет и механика этого шедевра в хорошем смысле слова , заставляет включить свою эмпатию, и начать сопереживать персонажам. Точнее не просто сопереживать, а ставить себя на их место. Причем делается это достаточно простыми, но очень эффективными способами. Вы думали Элизабет просто так вам патроны и аптечки кидает, когда совсем плохо становится? Нет! Именно из-за этой особенности игры, вам потом самим неосознанно захочется бежать и спасать её. 

И таких примеров множество, все элементы игровой механики и сюжета в Bioshock Infinite направлены на то, чтобы эмоционально затянуть не индивидуума, который тыкает по кнопочкам, а то что у него в голове и за её пределами, проще говоря личность. Такие игры встречаются очень редко и их можно пересчитать по пальцам одной руки.

Из-за этого трудно жаловаться на проблемы с игровой механикой, ибо постоянная нехватка патронов, денег и местного аналога маны под названием Salts, является не багом а фичей. Также, как графическая и звуковая составляющая, которые придали переживаемой истории, как ярких, так и мрачных красок. Хорошо что игра переведена субтитрами, ибо использование русской озвучки убило бы всю атмосферу напрочь.

Ну и напоследок скажу, что на Linux эта игра работает очень стабильно (вылетела всего один раз). Настоятельно рекомендуется тем, кто воспринимает игровую индустрию не как развлечение, а как искусство. Искусство, которое вызывает эмоции.

This game is simply amazing. The world and characters are such that i would like to keep exploring it forever. Shooting (which there is plenty) is good enough. It's not the best but it gets the job done. While there is a lot of killing there is also a lot of just wandering around with or without story elements.

The gameplay elements don't always mix with story and sometimes it's hard to take seriously a cutscene where a little wound takes a big role when you just before got shot 20 times. Or when you walk around town and steal everything from everyone and no one really cares. Gameplay elements (like the looting) and story (people reacting) are different parts and are kept separate in a way that sometimes is just weird. Enemy AI is also a bit on the passive side and the enemies give way too much breathing space. This meant that on hard difficulty i died less than ten times during the story mode. These are minor issues especially if you come for the story and atmosphere since those are unmatched in gaming.

I rarely want to play a game again after finishing it. Bioshock Infinite is one that i want to replay immediately.

Update: And i did! Though before that i completed Burial at Sea 1&2, which twist, bend and ultimately wrap up the storyline so that you can better enjoy the main story again. This time i completed on the 1999 mode which is the hardest of hard modes. This mode offered atleast some challenge at times but also brought out some of the flaws. For example the controls are a bit of a hit and miss at times especially when grinding on rails. On other difficulties this was not an issue since the enemies were not as deadly.

What also was brought up was the absolute marvel that this game is story-wise and with the setting. Elizabeth and Booker are an exellent duo and the city is such a visual treat. The story has lots of twists but talking about them would ruin the experience. I recommend Bioshock Infinite to just about anyone. If you are new to shooters just play on easy and soak up the story and atmosphere. Just play it. You won't regret it.

a fun themepark / rollercoaster ride - the main game I felt was far to short in a age of 40-60 hour games I was able to complete this in a sad 13 hours even going back and playing all the side achievements (not even quests cause there is none) this game was just WAY to short for the price tag 

the game over all was entertaining and had some nice twists and the rips in space were a nice touch - with some interesting combat - but once again compared to bioshock 1 and 2 it was just so short the story was great the look was great but I just can't get over the fact I finished this game in 3 days of casual play not even hard core play just some after noons after I did other things 

final verdict - if you get it on sale I'd buy it again - but I would not pay full price for it - I'm really hoping the DLC gets me to at least 100 hours or I'm gonna be unlikely to buy the next bioshock which hurts since I really enjoyed the series

По моему скромному мнению, Bioshock Infinite является лучшей игрой в серии игр Bioshock.
Bioshock Infinite это не только экшен, шутер и т.д., это также очень красивая игра, которую можно приобрести хотя бы ради того, что бы любоваться ее великолепными видами. Плавное введение в сюжетную линию, любование красотами, гармонично сменяется лихими перестрелками и динамичными поездками по аэротрассам.
А уж про большие и чувствительные глаза главной героини, вообще промолчу...

10 солей из 10.

ЗЫ: Если решитесь на покупку, обязательно покупайте Season Pass. Удачи.

Что такое BioShock Infinite? Это невероятно красивый мир и захватывающий сюжет. Если вы стоите перед выбором: покупать или нет - одозначно покупать! 
От игры не оторваться, сюжетные повороты всё больше и больше захватывают, и ты уже не можешь остановиться, пока не пройдешь игру полностью и не узнаешь всё. 
Игра безумно понравилась, рекомендую к прохождению :)

После всего проведённого времени в Bioshock Infinite я понял, насколько это прекрасная игра.. Эти ощущения, эти эмоции, просто не передать словами.. Как по мне, так это лучшая игра своего времени. Здесь есть всё, что нужно в играх подобного жанра: Прекрасный саундтрек, великолепный сюжет, отличная атмосфера и бесподобные персонажи.

I've been to Shivering Isles, the realm and kingdom of Sheogorath, the Prince and God of Madness. But, in any single aspect of that realm, I never felt such overwhelming, giant, depressing insanity as the one I experienced while playing this game. This whole thing would have suited Sheogorath much better than the Isles - one big, huge, multidimensional asylum that would be best cured with a nuclear blast. It was so mentally exhausting that I'm strongly tempted to click the "Don't Recommend" button.

Still, I have some understanding of why there was so much fuss about this game when it was released. My first hours in it were almost fabulous - pure enjoyment, utmost pleasure. I have no doubt that most of the reviewers in game magazines and journals never made it any further and reflected those good feelings in their reviews. If I stopped playing after 3 or 4 hours, I would also have written a review consisting of excited, positive emotions only.

I also find it probable that the game is just executed in a tradition which is quite alien to me. I never played any of the Bioshock titles, so I never knew what to expect and how it all should be in general. But still, getting to the conclusion was feeling like carrying a heavy burden, I just wanted to get over with it and close the game. Some hours ago, when I was starting it to play the final chapters, my only thoughts were "okay, let's just end this".

That's what I have to say about the plot and the atmosphere. Awesome beginning, terrible ending, and a slowly developing gradient from the first to the second in the middle.

Graphically it's good but not exciting. I was rather surprised to find some long forgotten graphical methods in a 2012 game. Still, it's generally pleasant to the eye.

Combat is good, diverse and also generally entertaining despite some poor design choices (like where you have a selection of spells but constantly stick to one of those you found first because it's the most useful anyway).

Player-to-ally relations were already desribed in good detail by various reviewers, so I'll just say that we got our little cute Alyx Vance here along with a set of features that make her quite useful.

My conclusion would be this: the game is good, and it's worthy of a try, especially if you like Bioshock titles in general, but it did not entirely come up with my expectations, and I'm personally more disappointed than satisfied. I can only choose between "Recommend" and "Don't Recommend", but if there was a "Mixed" verdict in addition, I would certainly had chosen this one.
令人印象 深刻的剧情和操作，非常推荐

Really aweosme story line.

One of the best single player games I've played so far, right up there with Metro 2033 and Last Light, The Last of Us, etc.

Combat can be a little too predictable from time to time but it can be quite challenging in high difficulties non the less. 

8/10

Another solid game in the Bioshock series, but this one has a bit of a different feel to it.

Columbia is like some place out of a dream, as opposed to Rapture which is more of a nightmare. You are never really alone in Columbia because it is a living, breathing city, from the bright city streets to the slums. There really is alot to take in and the gameplay really has you explore it fully.

The gameplay and combat mechanics are really fun with all the guns and vigors at your disposal. Cycling through all the different strategies to killing enemies really keeps the game fresh.

The story unfolds itself at a good pace and takes some huge turns at some points. Like, I mean HUGE turns. That being said the plot is very good and well conveyed to the player, plus it's definitely long enough suit the needs of someone after a true, fully fleshed out narrative.

The biggest difference from Bioshock 1 and 2 to Infinite is the atmosphere. The atmosphere to this game is very bright and beautiful, but much of its beauty comes to be seen in a negative light.

I really enjoyed this game and I hope you do, too.
Fucking amazing game. I cried 3 seperate times on the first run. If you haven't played this, and liked the first bioshock, you need to play this.

Excelente historia, buena musica y buenos escenarios ambientados en 1912 (Año en el que choco el titanic si no mal recuerdo), aunque la historia no este "ligada" a los demas juegos de bioshock tiene algunas referencias que te van a encantar, la jugabilidad es muy diferente en algunos aspectos pero eso de llevar plasmidos y un arma seguira siendo lo mismo. 

Lo recomiendo bastante se ve que se esforzaron en este juego especialmente el como ultilizaron el motor grafico Unreal Engine muy buen optimizado a diferencia de bioshock 1 y 2. 10/10 :)

The best out of the BioShock series. The story, including the DLC's Burial at Sea 1 and 2, is a brilliant odyssey of plot twists and interpretations with solid and intuitive gameplay mechanics which at the end will still leave you wondering about what you actually accomplished. 10/10.
